timeline.bodyText: Should we make it clear that only these 3 options are allowed from ssl.? (This ould be applied to all of these)
timeline.author: scholzj
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+Use `ssl` configuration options to run external listeners on a specific _cipher suite_ for a TLS version.

replies.bodyText:
Use the three allowed ssl configuration options to run external listeners on a specific cipher suite for a TLS version.
A cipher suite combines algorithms for secure connection and data transfer.
replies.author: PaulRMellor

timeline.message:
Regenerate API reference after conflict in rebase

Signed-off-by: Jakub Scholz <www@scholzj.com>

timeline.bodyText: is it "on a specific cipher suite" the right one? or should it be "with a specific cipher suite"? Same comment for all the other files.
timeline.author: ppatierno
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+Use the three allowed `ssl` configuration options to run external listeners on a specific _cipher suite_ for a TLS version.

timeline.bodyText: TLSv1.2 and TLSv1.2 ? Same question for all the other files.
timeline.author: ppatierno
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+Use the three allowed `ssl` configuration options to run external listeners on a specific _cipher suite_ for a TLS version.
+A _cipher suite_ combines algorithms for secure connection and data transfer.
+
+.Example SSL configuration
+[source,yaml,subs="attributes+"]
+----
+spec:
+  clusters:
+    config:
+      ssl.cipher.suites: "TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384" <1>
+      ssl.enabled.protocols: "TLSv1.2" <2>
+      ssl.protocol: "TLSv1.2" <3>
+----
+<1> The cipher suite for TLS using a combination of `ECDHE` key exchange mechanism, `RSA` authentication algorithm,
+`AES` bulk encyption algorithm and `SHA384` MAC algorithm.
+<2> The SSl protocol `TLSv1.2` is enabled.
+<3> Specifies the `TLSv1.2` protocol to generate the SSL context.
+Allowed values are `TLSv1.2` and `TLSv1.2`.

replies.bodyText: Allowed values are TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2.
replies.author: PaulRMellor

timeline.message:
add config for ssl ciphers

Signed-off-by: prmellor <pmellor@redhat.com>
